entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 01.23.26
entry.summary: State Representative Virgle Osborne talks about the Governor’s race, funding for the Oregon Department of Transportation, and what is ahead during the short session of the Oregon State Legislature.

entry.title: Multiple 4-H quiz bowls scheduled for Feb. 7
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Douglas County 4-H members and supporters are invited to Small Animal, Livestock, Dog and Poultry Quiz Bowls on Saturday, Feb. 7.

entry.title: New year, new reading resolutions
entry.summary: As I get older, I have become more intentional in selecting the books with which I choose to spend my time. At the beginning of the year, I think about what I want to read and why.

entry.title: Ferns are a great addition to your shady landscape
entry.summary: Question: I would like to add ferns to my landscape. Can you give me advice on growing ferns?

entry.summary: New Republican candidate for Governor, State Representative Ed Diehl joined us to talk about his campaign and why he wants to be Governor.

entry.title: Roseburg Warming Center Activated Saturday Night With Delayed Opening After 7 PM
entry.summary: The Roseburg Warming Center will be activated Saturday night, Jan. 24, with delayed check-in after 7 p.m. and overnight hours from 9 p.m. to 6:30 a.m. Space is first-come, first-served at St. Joseph’s Gymnasium in Roseburg.

entry.title: Police Log: January 22, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations in incidents spanning Jan. 22-23, including several warrant arrests, a DUII arrest, a burglary tools case, and multiple city ordinance and camping violations, according to the city’s daily police logs.

entry.title: "The Power of Place" photography exhibit comes to Roseburg Public Library
Reedsport Main Street program advances to Designated Main Street tier
entry.summary: On Tuesday, Oregon Main Street (OMS) announced that four Oregon-based associations have advanced to the next tier of the Oregon Main Street Network. Among them, one Douglas County town's Main Street program was chosen for the honor.

entry.title: Winston-Dillard SD teaches students table etiquette when dining fine
entry.summary: WINSTON — Fifth grade student Hayden Shryock said he was surprised it took him "a decade" to learn about polite dining.

entry.title: Deputy’s Patrol Vehicle Struck During Late-Night Stop Attempt Near Riddle, Court Records Say
entry.summary: Riddle man Damien Tobias Saltzman, 45, was jailed after deputies reported a late-night crash on Boyer Road, a short vehicle pursuit, and a collision with a sheriff’s vehicle. No injuries were reported. Charges include DUII and felony attempting to elude.

Thursday afternoon the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office reported that 70-year-old George Curtis Callaway had been reported missing. The man had last been seen on January 15th when he departed the Salmon Harbor RV Park in Reedsport, driving a...

entry.title: OREGON’S UNEMPLOYMENT RATE WAS 5.2 PERCENT IN DECEMBER
entry.summary: January 23, 2026 3:50 a.m. Oregon’s unemployment rate was 5.2 percent in both November and December. The U.S. unemployment rate was 4.5 percent in November and 4.4 percent in December. A State of Oregon Employment Department release said in December, Oregon’s seasonally adjusted nonfarm payroll employment dropped by 2,200 jobs, following a gain of 800...

entry.title: UCC OPENS NEWLY RENOVATED ADVANCED MANUFACTURING/FORESTRY HUB

The milestone represents...

entry.title: OSU EXTENSION WITH QUIZ BOWLS ON FEBRUARY 7TH
entry.summary: January 23, 2026 3:05 a.m. OSU Extension 4-H is holding small animal, livestock, dog, and poultry quiz bowls on Saturday, February 7th. entry.title: GOVERNOR KOTEK APPOINTS OREGON STATE FORESTER
entry.summary: January 23, 2026 2:50 a.m. On Thursday, Oregon Governor Tina Kotek announced that she has appointed Kacey KC to serve as State Forester and Director of the Oregon Department of Forestry. A release from the Governor’s Office said KC would be the first woman appointed on a permanent basis to lead the agency in state...

entry.title: Roseburg Benefit Car Show Returns March 14 and 15, Raising Funds for Search and Rescue and Local Children in Need
entry.summary: The 47th Annual Roseburg Benefit Car Show returns March 14-15, 2026 at the Douglas County Fairgrounds. Proceeds benefit Douglas County Search and Rescue and the Special Equipment Fund for children with disabilities. Vehicle entries due Feb. 20 at strayangelscarclub.com.

entry.title: Veterans Affairs in-person mental health care services reduced due to ongoing protests
entry.summary: Veterans will no longer be able to receive in-person mental health care services at the Old Federal Building on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. And according to a local veteran, it's because of continued protests at the building.

entry.title: Douglas County highlights park safety upgrades with Wi-Fi, updated life vest stations, and new camera at Chief Miwaleta
entry.summary: Douglas County officials say safety upgrades are underway at several parks, including new Wi Fi in low cell coverage areas, updated life vest stations at boat ramps, and a live streaming camera at Chief Miwaleta County Park near Galesville Reservoir to show lake and launch conditions.

entry.title: Studio Arts Connection bringing watercolor, yarn arts, jewelry making, and gallery space to Roseburg
entry.summary: Studio Arts Connection is opening soon in Roseburg at 1350 NE Stephens St. #10, next to Subway. Owner Sharon Bedford will offer watercolor, knitting, crochet, jewelry-making, and open studio time. First class is Feb. 4 with a Valentine card watercolor project.

entry.title: Johnny Barrett of Riddle Earns Eagle Scout Rank After Completing 236 Hour Service Project
entry.summary: Johnny Barrett of Troop 36 in Riddle has earned the rank of Eagle Scout after completing a 236 hour service project building benches for a local baseball field. Barrett plans to graduate in 2026 and is pursuing dual credit coursework in UCC’s Mechatronics program.

entry.title: Roseburg literacy event offers free books and fun for families
entry.summary: Roseburg Schools is hosting an exciting early childhood literacy event on Monday. This initiative is part of the district's efforts to boost literacy development across the community.

entry.title: New Lemur House Completed at Wildlife Safari, Lemurs Return to Walk Thru Safari
entry.summary: Wildlife Safari has completed a brand new lemur house in the free Walk Thru Safari. The larger, heated space includes big windows and can be divided for new introductions or maternity needs. The lemurs have returned to their updated island home.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 01.22.26
entry.summary: Live from Washington D.C. fourth district Congresswoman Val Hoyle talks about federal forestry policy, continued work on getting funding for a state veterans home in Roseburg, and a variety of other topics.

entry.title: Douglas County Board of Commissioners address human trafficking awareness, disaster relief funding and more
entry.summary: On Wednesday, the Douglas County Board of Commissioners held a meeting in which service was recognized, human trafficking awareness was discussed and next steps on disaster relief funding for the March 2025 floods were taken.

entry.title: Adapt reports vendor data breach
entry.summary: Adapt Integrated Health Care has given notice that one of its third-party vendors has reported a possible data breach.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 01.22.26
entry.summary: Dr. David DeRose, specialist in internal and preventative medicine, talks about the free health seminar he is leading from with sessions Thursday night through Sunday at the Better Living Center Roseburg Seventh Day Adventist Church in Roseburg.

entry.title: Man Arrested After Reported Firearm Theft From Vehicle at Waldron’s Outdoor Sports
entry.summary: Roseburg police arrested Alan Daniel Hubschman, 34, after officers reported he stole a loaded firearm from a vehicle at Waldron’s. Police said he was located in a tent on a walking bridge and the firearm was recovered.

entry.title: Police Log: January 21, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations Jan. 21–22, including a parole warrant arrest, a probation violation, a firearm theft investigation, a disorderly conduct arrest, and a burglary case involving stolen tobacco products.

entry.title: Drain's Ray's Food Place to close by end of February
entry.summary: On Tuesday, Drain resident Nancy Whitlock was out for a morning walk when she passed the Ray's Food Place and saw a new sign hanging from the side of the building, which reads "Store Closing. Everything Must Go!"

entry.title: UACT organizing father/daughter dance, tickets now on sale
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Umpqua Actors Community Theatre is now organizing the Douglas County Father/Daughter Winter Wonderland Dance.
